intro: Schmidtia utriculosa, commonly known as the bladderfruit, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squashes. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, lobed leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the inflated, bladder-like fruit that contains a single seed. Schmidtia utriculosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
